intro: Hieracium varatinense, commonly known as the Varatine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its leaves are basal and lance-shaped, with a rough texture, and its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium varatinense is generally not considered invasive and plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
